txt.en: 'Perhaps. But were I a minstrel, I would waste no breath to sing of him.'
'I grieve for the good men who died today.'
'King? Never! All your treachery will earn you is death!'
'Little fool. Saruman says ALL must die.'
'Death! Death take us all! For Thornhope!'
'Are you prepared to join us on the field of battle this day?'

'The battle is over, our enemy is routed, and Hytbold is secured. Can we really declare that we won this battle, though? Béortnoth, Radwig, Gísil, Athelward... we have paid a high price for this victory. Perhaps too high.'
'Are you prepared to vacate the field of battle?'
Defend the north flank with Harding, Gísling, Edgal, and Winsig
Ingbert calls out for aid on the south flank
'He thought to ruin us. Instead he has woken us and kindled our wrath.'
Defend the south flank with Ingbert, Fastred, Elfmar, and Mildrith
'Let the Wizard know... let all Men know... the Riddermark's courage slumbers no more!'
Radwig and Gísil have fallen! Join Ides in defending the centre
Defend the centre
Athelward has weakend the troll. Defeat it
The troll has fallen. Hytbold is saved, though the cost was great.
Hytbold -- and the Witan -- have fallen under siege by a great army of the Enemy.
'Impossible!'
'So Wormtongue is not Saruman's only servant in these lands.'
'It is done. The Orcs are broken. They flee across the plains.'
'No coward, he. He died for his child's sake. Villain he may be, yet brave was his ending.'
Talk to Harding
'What? What for?'
Talk to Harding
Join Harding on the north flank
Defend the north flank
Join Ingbert on the south flank
Defend the south flank
Join Ides in the centre
Defend the centre
Defeat the troll
Regroup with the Lords of the Eastemnet
Defend Hytbold at all costs.
Defend Hytbold at all costs.
Defend Hytbold at all costs.
Defend Hytbold at all costs.
'Father! No!'
Defend Hytbold at all costs.
'Father, help me! Please!'
Defend Hytbold at all costs.
'Wretched beast! Taste my blade!'
Defend Hytbold at all costs.
Defend Hytbold at all costs.
'Curse you, Athelward! You have forgotten your fathers!'
Defend Hytbold at all costs.
'Alas for the mailed warrior! Dark comes! Night-shadows deepen!'
'A throng of Orcs out of the pits of Isengard...'
'Sent here to raze Hytbold and slay all who have gathered at this Witan.'
'How, you ask? Harding, you addled fool. They came because I let them!'
'Athelward! Glad am I to see you well and unharmed.'
'Of course not. The Wizard has given me his Orcs so that I may deliver the Mark to him.'
'What foe threatens us this day?'
'And in return, he shall make me King of all the Eastemnet.'
'But how came they so far into our lands without us knowing?'
'Quickly! Spread out, defend Hytbold! [placeholder], join me on the North side!'
'Burn it all! Tear it to the ground! Spare my daughter... but kill the rest.'
'My lords! What tidings bring you?'
'Hold! She is my child, and she must live! That was Saruman's word!'
'So, we have won. But at what cost? Béortnoth, Radwig, Gísil, Athelward....'
'Stop! Not my girl! Not Ides!
Harding waits to speak with you.
'As do we all. High is the price we have paid... perhaps too high. But victory is ours.'
'Ingbert, tell your Riders to let some of the Orcs go.'
'So that Saruman can hear the tale of this battle and tremble within his tower.'
'What!'
The Witan: The Battle for Hytbold
'Nay. It cannot be....'
'Not for long. Our riders will cut them down as they run. None shall return to Isengard.'
'That coward is hardly a loss.'
